Class GroupServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Server
      • GroupServer

  • public class GroupServer
extends Server
    Handles connections to the GroupClient. Creates a listener to accept incoming connections. Note however that the GroupServer does not know who is connecting to it, but will assume that the client understands the protocol.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      GroupList groupList
      The list of groups that the GroupServer has.
      static int SERVER_PORT
      The default port for GroupServers to listen from.
      UserList userList
      The list of users that the GroupServer has.

    • Field Detail

      • SERVER_PORT

        public static final int SERVER_PORT
        The default port for GroupServers to listen from. This port, should it be used, must be open in the firewall to accept external incoming connections.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • userList

        public UserList userList
        The list of users that the GroupServer has.

      • groupList

        public GroupList groupList
        The list of groups that the GroupServer has.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GroupServer

        public GroupServer()
        Default constructor. Uses the default port of 4321

      • GroupServer

        public GroupServer(int _port)
        Constructor to specify a port.
        Parameters:
        _port - An integer representing the port number to use to accept connections from.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Description copied from class: Server
        The method needs to be defined by any class that extends this method. This method will start the server.
